alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 9:43PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Keokuk and northwestern Jefferson Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 943 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Oskaloosa, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Delta around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hedrick, Hayesville, Martinsburg, Packwood, Abingdon and Richland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
